intro: Viola cornuta var. parvistipula, commonly known as the slender-stemmed violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of violet and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters, with hairy stems and lanceolate leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. The flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
